docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Aug. 18 -- The state of siege in Argentina, which forbids any discussion of international affairs, prevents the principal newspapers from commenting on the sinkings of Brazilian ships by submarines. Nevertheless the spokesmen...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Aug. 18 -- The state of siege in Argentina, which forbids any discussion of international affairs, prevents the principal newspapers from commenting on the sinkings of Brazilian ships by submarines. Nevertheless the spokesmen for all political parties condemned such methods of war and predicted that unrestricted submarine warfare, even if it excluded Argentina, would create difficult problems for President Ramon S. Castillo.

docs.snippet: In spite of the rationing of "gas" and tires "uninterrupted church attendance should be provided for in the nation-wide campaign to maintain transportation for war workers and essential civilian needs during the war," said a statement issued...
docs.lead_paragraph: In spite of the rationing of "gas" and tires "uninterrupted church attendance should be provided for in the nation-wide campaign to maintain transportation for war workers and essential civilian needs during the war," said a statement issued yesterday by the Highway Traffic Advisory Committee to the War Department through its director, J. Truman Thompson.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 22 -- Brazil's declaration of war upon Germany and Italy following the sinking by German submarines of five Brazilian ships forming part of a convoy in waters off the coast of Brazil came as a rude shock to those South Americans...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 22 -- Brazil's declaration of war upon Germany and Italy following the sinking by German submarines of five Brazilian ships forming part of a convoy in waters off the coast of Brazil came as a rude shock to those South Americans who imagined the war was taking place so far from their shores that it did not even distantly concern them.

headline.main: BRAZIL AT WAR STIRS LATINS; Action at Rio Drives Home Realization That No South American Nation Is Safe

byline.original: By ARNALDO CORTESISpecial Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 23 -- Chile will make known tomorrow her position with regard to Brazil's belligerency with Germany and Italy, informed circles predict, explaining that Chile's reaction probably will be explained when the text of the note...
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 23 -- Chile will make known tomorrow her position with regard to Brazil's belligerency with Germany and Italy, informed circles predict, explaining that Chile's reaction probably will be explained when the text of the note replying to the Brazilian communication is published.

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Aug. 23 -- Searchlights swept the skies over Rio de Janeiro's harbor as protection against surprise attack tonight and police-car sirens shrieked as authorities carried out an intensive round-up of spy suspects on Brazil's...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Aug. 23 -- Searchlights swept the skies over Rio de Janeiro's harbor as protection against surprise attack tonight and police-car sirens shrieked as authorities carried out an intensive round-up of spy suspects on Brazil's first day of war.

docs.snippet: Brazil as an active ally greatly improves the strategical position of the United Nations. It also adds 4,600 miles of Atlantic coastline to be defended by a nation with a negligible navy. It took courage for an exposed and vulnerable country to...
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil as an active ally greatly improves the strategical position of the United Nations. It also adds 4,600 miles of Atlantic coastline to be defended by a nation with a negligible navy. It took courage for an exposed and vulnerable country to choose war, but the Brazilians apparently face the risks gladly.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 23 -- After a conference between President Alfredo Baldomir and Foreign Minister Alberto Guani that lasted almost all night, Uruguay has decided to grant to Brazil all rights of nonbelligerency.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 23 -- After a conference between President Alfredo Baldomir and Foreign Minister Alberto Guani that lasted almost all night, Uruguay has decided to grant to Brazil all rights of nonbelligerency.
